hints.label: unlabeled-remark-68
hints.title: Structure of Proposed U(1) Phase
hints.content:
498: :class: note
499: 
500: The proposed phase θ_i^(new) has a fundamentally different structure from the current phase:
501: 
502: **Current:** θ_ik is **pairwise** — encodes relative geometry between i and k
503: **Proposed:** θ_i is a **collective local value** — encodes i's position relative to entire swarm
504: 
505: This is not a single-particle property (depends on μ_d, σ'_d from all walkers) nor a two-particle property (not symmetric/antisymmetric under i ↔ k). It is a **collective field** evaluated at walker i.

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-128
hints.title: Non-Recursion in SU(2) Phase
hints.content:
558: :class: important
559: 
560: The phase θ_ij^(new) = S_i(j) / ℏ_eff uses V_fit,i which was computed from the **diversity companion** c_div(i), NOT the cloning companion c_clone(i).
561: 
562: **Causal independence:**
563: - V_fit,i computed using c_div(i) (Step 6)
564: - Cloning score S_i(j) uses V_fit plus independently sampled c_clone(i) = j (Step 8)
565: 
566: If we interpret the phase as applying to the (i, j = c_clone(i)) pair, then:
567: - Phase uses fitness values that were computed BEFORE c_clone(i) was sampled
568: - No circular dependency exists

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-170
hints.title: Difference from Standard Model Higgs
hints.content:
600: :class: warning
601: 
602: The Standard Model Higgs field φ is an **SU(2)_L doublet**:
603: 
604: $$
605: \phi = \begin{pmatrix} \phi^+ \\ \phi^0 \end{pmatrix}
606: $$
607: 
608: with vacuum expectation value ⟨φ^0⟩ = v / √2.
609: 
610: The proposed Φ_Higgs(i) = r'_i is a **scalar singlet**—it does not transform under SU(2). This is a significant structural difference.
